column2: NEW JERSEY DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: New Jersey

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: only when other vehicles yield.
column6: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 2. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 3. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 4. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column4: the pedestrian

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 6. Speed limit signs are:
column4: warning signs

column2: 7. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when following motorcycles.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 8. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column6: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: you may stop to let out passengers.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: no turns are allowed on this road.
column8: the road may be slippery when wet.

column2: 10. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 11. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Do not enter.

column2: 12. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 13. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column10: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 14. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: they must not make a right turn.
column8: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 15. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.

column2: 16. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column6: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column8: watch for this species crossing the road.

column2: 17. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Diamond

column2: 18. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: must obey

column2: 19. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
column4: hand signals

column2: 20. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 21. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column4: parking lights.

column2: 22. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: No one.

column2: 23. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 24. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column8: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column10: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 25. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 26. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column10: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 27. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your eyes off the road
column6: take your hands off the wheel
column8: take your attention away from driving

column2: 28. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: emergency flashers.

column2: 29. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 30. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To halt the traffic flow.
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 31. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.

column2: 32. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column10: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 33. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.

column2: 34. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Brake early and gently.
column6: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column8: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 35. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column4: No-passing zone

column2: 37. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column4: turns sharply right, then left.

column2: 38. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: change lanes quickly.

column2: 39. This sign means:
column4: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 40. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 41. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column6: slow down before entering the curve.
column8: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column10: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.

column2: 42. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should stop walking immediately.
column6: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 43. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column6: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column8: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column10: drive slowly so you can check traffic.

column2: 44. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 45. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Never.
column6: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 46. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column4: Weaving between lanes.
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 47. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: High emphasis warning.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 48. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must change lane immediately.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 49. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column10: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 50. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
